container.containing-doc: Upper Mattaponi Tribal Code of Law
container.heading: Tribal Contracts

section.heading: Short Title
section.text: This chapter shall be known as, the "The Employment Contracts Authorization Act of 2023" ("Act").

section.heading: Purpose
section.text: The purpose of this chapter is to authorize the Chief to enter into employment contracts with qualified individuals to serve as the Director of Finance and as the Director of Facilities and Infrastructure, which may include a limited waiver of sovereign immunity to allow for the enforcement of the employment contracts in the Tribe's Judicial Branch of government.

section.heading: Findings
section.text: The Council hereby finds and declares that:

para.text: On July 22, 2023, the citizens of the Upper Mattaponi Tribe ("Tribe") voted to adopt a new constitution ("Constitution") to assert the Tribe's sovereign authority as a federally-recognized Indian tribe and to reorganize the Tribe's government to exercise its full authority in a fair and equitable manner; and,
The Constitution establishes an executive branch of government comprised of the Chief, Assistant Chief, and various Departments and programs; and,

The Department of Finance, the Department of Records Management, and other key Departments serve critical needs in the operation of the Tribe's government, and employing well-qualified individuals as Directors of these Departments will help ensure the efficient and professional delivery of services; and,

In order to retain well-qualified individuals to serve in these critical positions, the Tribe must offer enforceable employment contracts in order to attract experienced professionals to work for the Tribe; and,

The Council has determined that it is in the best interests of the Tribe to authorize the Chief to enter into employment contracts with Directors of key Departments in the Tribe, and to authorize a limited waiver of sovereign immunity to allow for the enforcement of the employment contracts in the Tribe's Judicial Branch of government.

section.heading: Authorization of Employment Contracts to Key Directors
section.text: The Council hereby authorizes the Chief to enter into employment contacts with well- qualified individuals to serve as the Director of the Department of Finance, the Director of the Department of Records Management, and other Directors and professional personnel of key Departments in the Tribe identified by the Chief. In recognition that each Chief elected to serve will desire to employ key policy making, 'cabinet-level', and administrative appointees, all policy-level personnel, key administrative staff, and political appointees shall not be entitled to an employment contract with the Tribe and shall serve at the pleasure of the Chief.

section.heading: Limited Waiver of Sovereign Immunity
section.text: The Chief shall be authorized to include a limited waiver of sovereign immunity in the employment contracts for the Director of the Department of Finance, the Director of the Department of Records Management, and other Directors of key Departments to allow for the enforcement of the contracts; provided, that such waiver shall be limited exclusively to the payment of up to three years annual salary of the effected individual, and that enforcement of the contracts shall be exclusively in the Judicial Branch of government of the Tribe.

container.heading: The Executive, Legislative, and Judicial Branches Contracting Authority Act

section.heading: Short Title
section.text: This chapter shall be known as, the "THE EXECUTIVE, LEGISLATIVE, AND JUDICIAL BRANCHES CONTRACTING AUTHORITY ACT OF 2023 ("Act").

section.heading: Purpose
section.text: The purpose of this chapter is to authorize each branch of government to contract for services and supplies in accordance with funds appropriated for such purposes in an approved budget.

para.text: On July 22, 2023, the citizens of the Upper Mattaponi Tribe ("Tribe") overwhelmingly voted to adopt a new constitution ("Constitution") to assert the Tribe's sovereign authority as a federally-recognized Indian tribe; and,
The Constitution vests the Council with the authority to enact laws and budget resolutions; and,

The Executive, Legislative, and Judicial branches of government find it necessary to enter into contracts from time to time for services and supplies for their respective branches in order to fulfill their duties and responsibilities; and,

The Legislature finds the need to authorize officials from each branch of government to enter into contracts that are authorized by law in accordance with funds appropriated for such purposes within an approved budget.

The Chief and executive branch personnel shall not have the power to enter into contracts on behalf of the Tribe unless authorized to do so by law enacted by the Legislature or as otherwise authorized by Chapter 2.

The contracting process for the Tribe to enter into any contract shall include the following steps in the following order: (1) authorization to contract in a law enacted by the Council including Chapter 2, or by decision of the Council including Department and program enabling laws; (2) selection of the vendor or contracting party pursuant to procurement policies, and negotiation and execution of the contract by the Chief or an authorized designee; (3) ratification of the contract by the Council, but only when the authorizing law expressly reserves the power to the Council to ratify the contract.

Upon authorization in a law or by Chapter 2, the Chief, and executive branch personnel and subdivisions authorized by the Chief, shall have the power to select the vendor or contracting party in accordance with applicable procurement laws and policies, negotiate the contract terms with the vendor or contracting party, and enter into a contract with the vendor or contracting party on behalf of the Tribe subject to any limitations or conditions placed on the executive branch in the authorizing law including but not limited to the power of the Council to require ratification of a contract by the Council.

The Chief and executive branch personnel are hereby authorized to enter into routine contracts that are necessary for the Office of Chairman, a Department, or a program to carry out its duties and responsibilities; provided, that contacts over one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) shall be subject to ratification by the Council.

Any expenditure of funds by the executive branch of government shall be done in accordance with the available funds appropriated in an approved budget in accordance with the requirements of the Constitution.

The Council hereby authorizes the Speaker of the Legislature, on behalf of the Council, to enter into contracts, as previously and specifically authorized by the Council by Legislative Rule, to hire employees, professional advisors, consultants, and others to assist the Council and individual Representatives with fulfilling their duties to enact laws and prepare budget resolutions for the benefit of the citizens of the Tribe.

The Speaker of the Council shall have the authority to enter into contracts for supplies or services for the Council as specifically authorized by Legislative Rule passed by the Council, subject to an appropriation of funds in an approved budget for such purposes.
The services provided under any services contract entered into by the Council shall be limited to the exclusive benefit and use of the Council.
Any contract entered into on behalf of the Council shall include a provision stating that such contract may be canceled at any time and for any reason by the Council.

The Council hereby authorizes the Chief Justice of the High Court, on behalf of the Judicial branch of government, to enter into contracts to hire professional advisors, consultants, and others to assist the courts with fulfilling their duties to the citizens of the Tribe.
The Chief Justice shall have the authority to enter into contracts for supplies or services for the courts, subject to an appropriation of funds in an approved budget for such purposes.
The services provided under any services contract entered into by the Chief Justice shall be limited to the exclusive benefit and use of the courts.
Any contract entered into on behalf of the Judicial branch shall include a provision stating that such contract may be canceled at any time and for any reason by the Chief Justice.
